title: Pool Party Miss Fortune Splash Art
body:
https://2.bp.blogspot.com/-zRXjYhZPpW8/V31XEkMBMJI/AAAAAAAA8Xg/4588_qRGcwwKf1juJ6tVp-XrXKH3Tgr9QCLcB/s1600/MissFortune_Splash_9.jpg
Other Champs: Lux, MUNDO, Blitz, Lee
Source: http://www.surrenderat20.net/2016/07/76-pbe-update.html

replies.body:
Most splashes I don't like just lower my enthusiasm for the skin a little bit. I still get the skin, I'm just sad that I won't enjoy looking at the loading screen splash. However, this splash is bad enough that it actually kind of ruins the fantasy of the skin for me a bit. Having played with the skin on the PBE, it's supposed to be a tongue in cheek skin of MF having fun at the pool. The selfie recall defines the skin to me, with MF being cool and relaxed, confident in how sexy she looks.

This splash though... Why does she almost look angry? She looks like she's stressed about taking the picture more than anything else. And this might sound odd but I just think her facial features are so masculine. I have a fair amount of exposure to drag culture and all I can see in her face is a man in drag rather than an actual woman. The eyes and eyebrows just have it.

I don't like just how enthusiastic everyone is in the background either. MF doesn't look excited or like she's trying to take a fun picture, so why are Lux and Lee so excitable by comparison? It's like they couldn't decide between a 'sexy' splash (MF, supposedly) or a fun one (everyone else) and as a result it just looks messy when looked at together. 

I loved Fiora's (some oddly drawn faces but otherwise fine) and respected Taric's (don't like the art style but it's well-made) but I'm really disappointed by MF's, which is a huge pity because it's the skin I like the most in-game. There's nothing we can even do to get it changed now though, given they put it up at the very end of the cycle.
Thank god I thought I was the only one who thinks her face looks screwed up.

With you 100% on the masculine face sentiment. It really doesn't help that the shade of red used just doesn't look real, because that really makes it hard to see anything besides a guy in a wig. I imagine this is actually a picture of Miss Fortune's stunt double trying to look sexy.

However when viewing the splash at full size it's not quite as bad. The things that need to be fixed are her eye on the right side of her head (it's a little too wide and makes her head look strange), and her mouth/jawline area (her mouth is a little too big and the backside of her jaw is a little low/rounded). Unfortunately the sizes on her face combine with the angle to make it look strange.
Honestly my biggest issue with her face is the placement of the arch in her eyebrows.
The quality of this is terrible compared to the one Fiora got. I guess they were the work of different artists?
Ya more than likely, I feel it would be a lot of work for one person to do all of them
Back in the day, when they were doing Art Showcases of doing splash arts, the time required for one could go as low as 8 hours.
When was that? These days they usually take 4-6 weeks.
Really? I mean I'm no artist believe me but 4-6 weeks seems like a long ass time for a splash art.

You are right that if one were to actually just paint a splash from the beginning to end it would take much less time. We usually go through many thumbnails, then many color comps, then many, many iteration and feedback loops on every splash. That's why I say 4-6 weeks as it varies depending on feedback/iteration.

Are you guys paying attention to the community feedback on this? Because I don't remember a splash that was more poorly received than this.

As someone who wants to buy the skin but won't be able to bring himself to do so if this is attached to it, I really want to hear you'll consider changing it.

EDIT: To clarify, I meant to talk about skin splashes -_- Obviously the reaction to this is nothing like the reaction to stuff like Fiora's updated splash.

> Because I don't remember a splash that was more poorly received than this.

I take it you don't remember the first update to Ahri's base splash? Or Fiora's rework splash? Or Katarina's updated splash? Or Tristana's first post-rework splash? Or like, nearly all of the splash arts in the unification process?

I get that you're disappointed in the splash, and that's fine, but you're being a little dramatic. If those past examples are anything to go off of, they'll change it. Just keep things constructive.
I'm still extremely salty about Ahri's splash. Every single time I see the new one, I desperately want the old one back.

It would be so easy too...

http://knkl.deviantart.com/art/AHRI-League-of-Legends-Fan-Splash-517882502?q=gallery%3AKNKL%2F4685075&qo=28

The old one is still meh, especially in comparison to the recent art, but I'm still disappointed because there is so much amazing ahri fan art out there (even ones done by rioters in their spare time), and the current one just doesn't seem up to that standard.
Still meh, but still better than the current. At least the fan arts still look like her.

Sorry, I meant skin splashes. It's understandable that people get angry about champion splash updates because if you don't like it, but you liked the old one, it's a huge downgrade that you don't want. But people rarely get up in arms about skin splashes because nothing came before them. Katarina turning into a drug addict was terrible, and Fiora being pretty ugly naturally got a big reaction, but poor skin splashes very rarely get harsh criticism.

I'm not trying to be dramatic, it's mostly just poor wording on my part and the fact that skin splashes rarely get a big response unless they're updates like the splash art unification or things like the Nidalee/Trundle splash updates. Hopefully I sound a bit less like I'm losing my head now.

Oh, I completely understand disappointment regarding splash art, I mostly singled your comment out since it seemed uncharacteristically hyperbolic (you usually have pretty balanced opinions). Basically my "Here, have a Snickers," though I could have probably come off less confrontational. I've just been so sassy lately, maybe I need one as well, lol.
Na, your post was completely fine :) You were right to call me out on what I seemed to be saying. Still, might as well have the Snickers while you're talking about it.

Hmm, so you all looked at the MF splash art and then at the other ones and thought "Yeah, that's good."? Maybe you all thought it was a Katarina skin.

It's not _just_ drawing a picture. It's a team effort- The process of creating a splash for League is more complicated than you think.
An illustration like this will usually start as a bunch of thumbnails, one (or two) of which the team will settle on and build the final splash off.
It's also a lot of iteration- The main artist/s will usually come and ask for feedback from the team, from time to time between taking a breaks from working on the splash.
And sometimes something could go wrong and only when it's finished would the team realize that it could be better, so they'd have to take it back to the drawing board for a few more days.

I probably missed a lot of other general things that happen during the collaborative creation of splash art in League though, so forgive me for this. ;P

Have you ever actually seen an anorexic person?

Their face isn't sharp, it's flat and the bones can be seen. Their breasts are shriveled up. Her hipbones would be sticking out from her sides. Her ribs would be visible through her swimsuit. Her collarbone would be visible. Her body wouldn't be curved, it would be thin and rigid. Her legs would be cylinders with visible bone. Her hair would probably be thin and look horrible because of the lack of nourishment. 

Anorexia is a serious condition that leads to obvious symptoms if it continues, it is not just "someone looks thin" or "someone doesn't look attractive to me". You using it in this manner is basically turning it into a buzzword - "If I say this, I sound more serious and important"

I'm sorry, a serious illness should not be used as an exaggeration of any kind. I am sorry if my comment hurt someone's feelings or played this illness down, I was not quite aware of the effects this comment could cause. I will ofc edit it out asap and think twice about what I am comparing. It just was like the first term that came to my mind (which is kind of troublesome, I guess), I am not a native speaker of English.

I didn't make the comment out of concern for hurt feelings, though I appreciate your willingness to realize how it could be that way. I just don't like serious words with specific meanings being used for bad comparisons, and I have a bit of a peeve about anorexia because I've seen it misused this way a number of times. A lot of people seem to use it as synonymous with "body type thinner than my personal preference"

All of this said I have to agree the splash is pretty bad, especially when Fiora's is godlike.
